item.title: 0003 - Use Prisma
item.description: Supporting evidence We noted working with Postgres directly was complex and time consuming, we opted to look at ORM solutions to aid in the development of a datasafe layer to handle all db interactions. We will Add Prisma Layer on top of PostgreSQL.Drizzle https://orm.drizzle.team/ Main site has a lot of negative reviews coming from their own twitter showcase feed. Project looks new and immature. Positive • A proper ORM will make it easier to migrate data in the future, as well as safely interact with the DB now during the development of a new site on existing data. Risks & Trade-offs • Implementing prisma will require a complete refactor of the production database. Follow-up actions Not Applicable

item.title: 0002 - Use PostgreSQL
item.description: Supporting evidence I considered switching the db from postgres to best fit a serverless api and the new nuxt stack. We will Use PostgreSQL. Maria Firestore Positive • All existing data is already on postgres Risks & Trade-offs • In order to implement Prisma, or otherwise expand site functionality, we will need to refactor the entire database Follow-up actions [ ]

item.title: 0001 - Build Portal in Nuxt Stack
item.description: Supporting evidence After assessing stacks the new developer is most familiar with, we determined the feature set of NUXT on Nitro with Vite would best serve the long term features of polymart. We will Build Overhaul in Nuxt Stack. T3 Stack Next Stack Retaining PHP Positive • This should result in fastest development time without issues or bugs Risks & Trade-offs • Careful consideration will need to be made when choosing how to apply the hybrid rendering system nuxt provides. Follow-up actions [ ]
